job_title: Senior Business Development Consultant - Independent Reference Lab
job_description:
What Account Management contributes to Cardinal Health
Direct Sales is responsible for driving sales and services to new and/or existing customers through face-to-face or telephone contact to meet individual and organizational sales objectives.

Account Management is responsible for cultivating and maintaining on-going customer relationships with an assigned set of customers. Provides new and existing customers with the best possible service and recommendations in relation to billing inquiries, service requests, improvements to internal and external processes, and other areas of opportunity. Provides product service information to customers and identifies upselling opportunities to maintain and increase income streams from customer relationships.

Job Summary

The Senior Business Development Consultant will be instrumental in developing and growing corporate relationships within the Independent Reference Laboratory (IRL) Market for the East region. This individual will foster key relationships at the C-suite level, serve as a key stakeholder in the deal modeling process, and serve as a subject matter expert in product, kitting, service, and distribution capabilities for their assigned accounts.

Responsibilities
• Utilize performance measurement tools to track and sustain continuous improvement for initiatives and routine business needs.
• Review and address contract compliance by Cardinal Health and customer.
• Facilitate communication between customer and Cardinal Health sales, operations, customer service and field service to maintain and grow relationship between customer and Cardinal Health.
• Define and measure performance of potential/implemented solutions.
• Share industry and customer knowledge with Cardinal Health internal customers/Business Units.
• Demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of Cardinal Health and customer industry (ex. Terminology, technology, reimbursement, and govt. regulation, etc.)
• Take lead role in delivering complex broad-based portfolios of solutions that meet Cardinal Health and customer goals.
• Develop and direct implementation of programs designed to address customer profitability, safety, and business continuity objectives.
• Conduct customer discovery to identify customer needs and resulting opportunities.
• Identify process improvement opportunities for both the customer and Cardinal Health to reduce the “total delivered cost.”
• Facilitate request for data between customer and Cardinal Health.
• Design and facilitate implementation of Service Excellence programs to drive significant service performance improvements for customer including inventory/sourcing, supply chain quality, pricing management and customer service.
• Lead all customer acquisition implementations and manage the process with cross functional teams.
• Collaboratively work with Cardinal Hospital Lab and Aero-med IRL teams bridging the gaps on channel shift activity while also working to retain all Cardinal brand via the transition.
• Drive in-channel customer profitability via product conversions to Cardinal Brand products by successfully utilizing data and analytics tools to help drive savings for the customer and more profitability for Cardinal Health.
• Responsible for driving new distribution sales within the Independent Reference Labs market.
• Responsible to drive new kitting revenue in assigned territory.
• Primary owner/POC of the Corporate relationship with the Independent Reference Lab customer and work collaboratively with both the Aero-med Account Management teams as well as Cardinal Laboratory representatives.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent work experience.
• 6+ years sales and business development experience highly preferred.
• Healthcare industry experience highly preferred in the non-acute, lab, GPO, or kitting space.
• Critical thinker and problem solver.
• Entrepreneurial approach and mindset.
• Strong executive presence.
• Must reside in the East region.
• Ability and willingness to travel at least 25% in the East Region.

Anticipated pay range: $144,667 - $206,833 includes targeted variable pay

Bonus eligible: Yes

Benefits: Cardinal Health offers a wide variety of benefits and programs to support health and well-being.
• Medical, dental and vision coverage
• Paid time off plan
• Health savings account (HSA)
• 401k savings plan
• Access to wages before pay day with myFlexPay
• Flexible spending accounts (FSAs)
• Short- and long-term disability coverage
• Work-Life resources
• Paid parental leave
• Healthy lifestyle programs

Application window anticipated to close: 02/08/2024 *if interested in opportunity, please submit application as soon as possible.

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

Qualifications: Must reside in the East region
Ability and willingness to travel at least 25% in the East Region
